item.description:
Note, the start time has shifted to the final start time: 8:30 AM.

 

If the weather looks questionable, I will email RSVPed members 30 minutes before the scheduled meetup time to let everyone know whether it is still on or cancelled.

 

This session is for anyone just interested in rallying to develop their strokes (and any spillover from Crosby). Although, there is no formal structure, I suggest having drills to develop control and consistency. This session can also be used as an opportunity to practice serving and returning serves.

 

Suggested drills:

Mini-tennis: Confine your hitting within the service boxes. Good as a warm-up and focusing on controlled strokes.

 

Down the Line / Cross-court: With four people at a court, begin with hitting down the line to person directly in front of you, then switch to hitting cross court. Then switch sides with your partner so that you hit cross court on your forehand and backhand.

Variation: Add an element to this drill by attempting to continuously as long as possible. As soon as there is an error, both sides play out the remaining ball for points.

 

Volley / Overhand Practice: Have one side at net hitting volleys, while the other side hits back from the baseline. Switch.

 

Practicing Serves: This can also be done with four people on the court. One side of the court will practice serving while the other side will practice switching. Switch.
item.name: SUN: Rally/Practice/Play @ Dugger
